intro: Borreria ovalis f. abingdonensis, commonly known as the Abingdon's borreria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are typically arranged in opposite pairs along the stems. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or disturbed habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
